content.rendered:
Photo via Unsplash

Solid gold Genesis design talent on the podcast airwaves, theme teases galore, and a special theme setup offer from Susan Ramsey.

Themes

Scott over at Imagely, is teasing two new Genesis photography themes.

Two new Genesis child themes coming soon. Teasers at https://t.co/zyHutRitzu #WordPress #GenesisWP

— Scott Wyden Kivowitz (@scottwyden) November 15, 2016

Calvin Koepke with a sweet looking tease of his latest theme.

What else do you do on a Saturday night, but design #genesiswp themes? https://t.co/YhFhux8pYF pic.twitter.com/UMcZQXCj0E

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) November 20, 2016

Jesse Petersen with an update on his GenesisTheme project, with his second theme coming soon.

Made big strides yesterday to launching the 2nd @_GenesisTheme theme. A beautiful #mobilefirst #genesiswp blogging/magazine theme.

— Jesse Ⓦ Petersen (@jpetersen) November 15, 2016

Showcase

WPBeginner is rocking a new design on Genesis (h/t Brian Gardner).

Go check out the great new design @wpbeginner is sporting. Built on #genesiswp — https://t.co/l2xHPcUXua

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) November 16, 2016

Henrik Blomgren with a nice site based on the Maker Pro theme for deculture.se

New on https://t.co/vUGfVnMBds, new showcase site from @hb_se (based on @jtgrauke’s Maker Pro) https://t.co/rPk3NUFYAL pic.twitter.com/Ee3jJE2WSi

— GenesisWPguide (@GenesisWPguide) November 15, 2016

Mike Hemberger for arctica.com

Officially launched https://t.co/vj2b9iZHlR recently. Photography makes or breaks a site, but the design doesn’t hurt either 😉 #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/Cukrtf4GBe

— Mike Hemberger (@JiveDig) November 15, 2016

Couple of new sites from Jamie Mitchell. First, for a local architect, sheridanmiller.com.au

SITE LAUNCH: Custom website for local Architect firm goes live. https://t.co/qhNVtxUF1D #genesiswp #WordPress #smallbusiness #architecture pic.twitter.com/IEWMSxnLwa

— Jamie Mitchell (@jamiejmitchell) November 20, 2016

Second, for a local repair shop, usbmechanicalsmashrepairs.com.au

SITE LAUNCH: Custom website I built for a local smash repairer. https://t.co/mcyIpvIArN #genesiswp #WordPress #smallbusiness #webdesign pic.twitter.com/qtIu6VboL5

— Jamie Mitchell (@jamiejmitchell) November 20, 2016

Cami MacNamara, launches a new design (with a little help from Sridhar Katakam) for iasummit.org

New design by Webcami using Altitude Pro with help from @srikat's website tutorials! https://t.co/iack4rpmZ8 #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/VNshdDl1BW

— Cami MacNamara (@webcami) November 18, 2016

Doghouse Media for hardasoak.com

Website reboot in the bag – https://t.co/Uxg4fwQYsT – Ireland's toughest 10KM challenge #wordpress #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/AHpNxB9OvC

— Doghouse Media (@doghouse_media) November 18, 2016

PIXL Designs and ChurchPress for dare2share.org

Our team @pixldesigns and @churchpressco just launched a beautiful #genesiswp release of https://t.co/gYYpQFc3BF pic.twitter.com/4pW3dF0EWn

— Joshua Brown (@joshbrown) November 16, 2016

And finally, in the showcase for this week, Brian Gardner shares a little teaser of his latest personal site redesign.

Here’s a little more teaser on my personal redesign —> https://t.co/11cJ63Jhx3

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) November 18, 2016

Podcasts

On OfficeHours.fm, Carrie chats to one of my favourite designers in the Genesis community, Emily White.

New! Episode 119 – A Web Agency that's Happy Staying Small with @emwhitedesigns https://t.co/LNsM0zBMiO pic.twitter.com/0xjsJdvzu0

— Office Hours Podcast (@officehoursfm) November 14, 2016

While over on StudioPress.fm, Lauren and Brian chat to another awesome Genesis designer, Megan Gray, on staying creative in a distracted world.

New episode! How to Stay Creative in a Distracted World with @HouseofGrays — https://t.co/A8FnilTiH2 pic.twitter.com/h6JBwfaqYE

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) November 17, 2016

…and they’ve also finished recording for Season 1.

We're taking a little break for the holidays and returning with Season 2 in January #genesiswp https://t.co/QrctQtwmNU

— Lauren Mancke (@laurenmancke) November 15, 2016

Over on rethink.fm, Jackie D’Elia chats to Diane Kinney on designing user experiences.

Exploring our approach to web design. Design for #UX with @dkinney – Listen or read it here. #transcript #WordPress https://t.co/ktGgJET104 pic.twitter.com/u8iJMFf95B

— Rethink FM (@rethinkfm) November 18, 2016

Best of the rest…

Sridhar Katakam with a tutorial on how to replace the main background image in Infinity Pro (StudioPress’ latest theme) with rotating images (paid tutorial).

How to replace Front Page 1 background image in Infinity Pro with rotating images using Backstretch and Soliloquy:https://t.co/hi4bub0Pws pic.twitter.com/rQu7BTry49

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) November 13, 2016

The one and only, BobWP with a tutorial on fixing uneven featured posts on a Genesis child theme homepage.

How To Fix Uneven Featured Posts on a Genesis Child Theme Homepage https://t.co/GJj0RSPab3 #WordPress #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/51btH59hwA

— BobWP (@bobWP) November 19, 2016

And one from me, if you ever wanted to have the Remobile Pro menu always be open on ‘desktop’ (it’s closed by default), like you can see on GenesisWP.guide right now, check out the snippet I put together for Hans.

@iamnickdavis How do I get the menu of the Remobile Pro #genesiswp theme the same as you have on https://t.co/Ym5t5RVvaB Can you help me?

— Hans Martens (@HansMartens00) November 19, 2016

@HansMartens00 this should do it https://t.co/mkHTV0ybuf

— Nick Davis (@iamnickdavis) November 19, 2016

Handy looking Gulp toolkit for WordPress theme development from Craig Simpson (thanks to Jesse Petersen for sharing).

I found this in the #genesiswp Slack channels. Check it out if you use Gulp: https://t.co/moT9r8sVPd @craigsimps

— Jesse Ⓦ Petersen (@jpetersen) November 18, 2016

And finally…

If you want to support a good cause and get a WordPress website set up at a great price, check out this limited time offer from Susan Ramsey.

Looking for a #GenesisWP website refresh this weekend? Talk to me for special offer & help my son with his toy drive https://t.co/uHeDmy1HaG pic.twitter.com/TmPE0pYXcy

— Susan Ramsey (@onehappystudio) November 18, 2016

—

That’s all for this week.

Got something for next week? Go add it! Want to support what I’m doing? Go subscribe!

Hope a great week and I’ll see you soon.

excerpt.rendered: Solid gold Genesis design talent on the podcast airwaves, theme teases galore, and a special theme setup offer from Susan Ramsey.
